title: Xnsetena
body: In old records. An inditch; an interior ditch; one made within another, for greater security. Spelman

title: Xnsidiatores Viarum
body: Lat High-waymen; persons who lie in wait in order to commit some felony or other misdemeanor

title: Xenodochium
body: In the civil and old English law. An inn allowed by public II-cense, for the entertainment of strangers, and other guests. Calvin.; Cowell

title: Xenodochy
body: Reception of strangers; hospitality. Enc. Lond

title: Xylon
body: A punishment among the Greeks answering to our stocks, wharton.
